definition: to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: About 100 copies of the first Action Comics issue remain.
sentences.chinese: 《動作漫畫》的創刊號在全世界僅剩約100本。

sentences.english: Check that children have brought books for class or rent books for class.
sentences.chinese: 檢查學生是否帶書刊號或租書給孩子。

sentences.english: The first number of the pictorial leaped straight to success.
sentences.chinese: 畫報的創刊號一舉成功。

sentences.english: ISSN International Standard Serial Number is mean.
sentences.chinese: ISSN是國際標準刊號的意思。

sentences.english: Opening number refer to newspapers and periodicals begin first issue that publish formally.
sentences.chinese: 創刊號是指報刊正式開始刊行的第一期。
它的意思是“國際標準期刊刊號”。

sentences.english: The opening number is the documents and materials never out of date.
sentences.chinese: 創刊號是永遠不會過時的文獻資料。

sentences.english: 1889 - The first issue of the Wall Street Journal is published.
sentences.chinese: 1889年的今天，《華爾街日報》創刊號發行。

sentences.english: This is our first issue, and it may or may not meet your expectations.
sentences.chinese: 本季刊之創刊號能否符合你的期望呢？

definition: relations between levels of production/socio-economic relations
paper matrix in which type is set
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments

to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
